fields.description:
I'd like to be able to have profile versions, just like a normal page.... so when I screw it up, I can roll back. ;-)

Also -- the help text for "Notify on my actions" doesn't make sense:

"You also have the option to choose whether or not to get Notified on your own actions you do at system."

I know I have the option, no need to tell me. I know it's about notification of my actions". Don't have to tell me that... question remains... WHAT actions?

"Notify -- will send you a confirmation email when you create/edit pages, blog entries, or make comments."

Can't imagine why I'd want that feature, btw. ;-)

Timo
fields.summary: Profile versioning and help text

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-1909].
  {panel}

> Personally I think the "remove space" option should _not_
> be in the Space Admin... I don't like that a Space admin could delete 
> her space. I'd like to see that pulled out and up -- put it into the Global
> Admin stuff. I just see it as a liability, "Tim - HELP ME!!! I just 
> deleted my entire space!!! aaaagh!" <grin>

h3. Workaround
Refer to [How to customize Velocity Template to allow only a Confluence administrator to delete a Space|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-customize-velocity-template-to-allow-only-a-confluence-administrator-to-delete-a-space-1044776928.html] as a possible workaround to this feature request.
fields.summary: Space Administrators should not be able to Remove a space
Macro to include all child pages of a given page

fields.description:
It's quite hard to maintain large tables, since you can't separate several rows in the editor - if you separate them with empty line - table breaks. Should be possible to enter something like:

|foo|bar|
\\\\\
|foo|bar|

to visually separate text in page editor without introducing the new paragraph.
fields.summary: Add possibility to add (almost) empty line without introduce the paragraph

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-1906].
  {panel}

Confluence spaces tend to include contact information for various (external, not confluence using) people. Organisations tend to put their contact information in ldap-accessible directories. 

There is no link between these two at the moment. As a result the same information is split in different realms and probably gets out of sync sooner or later.

A macro that would query an ldap server and include the result would be great.

regards, Gunther

fields.description:
After attaching a file (tried with pdf, ascii text fiels, docs) that is correctly indexed by lucene (the document was found when providing words in the search mask) i have changed (edit & save) the wiki page where the file is attached.

After this step i inserted the same searchterm than before in the search mask, at this time the attachement isn't in the search hits any longer.

A few minutes ago i have tried it on the current Confluence test instance and got the same result (see http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/TEST/brads+test), so this has nothing to do with my specific setup.

best regards

Mathias Kimpl

fields.description:
I have been playing around with the Confluence UI, with the goal of simplifying the UI. Attached is a zip-file containing the affected Velocity templates + some new stuff. The changes have been made from version 1.2.1, as this was the current version a couple of weeks ago. To install, simply drop the zip file into a 1.2.1 installation. In short I have:

- Added JavaScript menus
- Simplified the appearance, especially of the Dashboard
- Simplified the navigation bar

The zip file also includes a short documentation and justification for the changes made. 

Jonas
fields.summary: Improved UI

fields.description:
Confluence 1.3 DR-1 looks to have issues identifying when to "start" the noformat text block. Specifically, spaces are ignored prior to the start of text. 

I created an example here:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/3SI

You can see the first line's spaces prior to the start of text is ignored, but subsequent spaces are accounted for in the remaining block of text.
fields.summary: {noformat} issue with first line of text.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-1882].
{panel}
In addition to sharing information within my company, we would like to use Confluence for sharing certain information with our customers and clients, and have it host our public website. The one thing that is holding us back from doing this is the inability to restrict who can see a user's profile. Profiles can even be viewed by anonymous users and to my knowledge there is no way to create a named user account without also creating a profile. Someone please correct me if I'm wrong. In our case, many of our clients are also direct competitors, and the last thing we want to do is give them a list of all our employees. The same concern also applies to the names at the top of each page, on the dashboard, in the search results, etc., that tell you who last changed the page and at what date and time.

I tried to come up with couple of ideas about how restriction of user profiles and user names might work. My preferred solution by far is number one but it may also be the most difficult to implement.

1. A user is only allowed to see the name and profile of another user if they are in the same group. (at least one group, not all)

2. Allow a global administrative option for enabling/disabling user names and profiles.

3. Allow each user to decide whether their name and/or profile should be viewable.

I think that this feature would be useful for many people, although I don't want to speak for other customers. Having such a feature would certainly allow the product to penetrate many more areas of my company.
{panel:title=Atlassian Status - December 2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
Thank you for your continued feedback on this issue. We do agree that restricting access to user names and profiles could be valuable for users, particularly in an externally-facing Confluence environments.

The use cases stemming from external collaboration do touch quite a number of features in the product including user profiles, people directory, mentions, shares, comments and search. In order to provide both a functional and watertight solution it is important to consider these various use cases, their impact on various features and the related front end and API implementations.

This feature request does form part of a larger long term initiative from which we hope to provide a solution for this issue in the future. We will update the status of this issue once we have made further progress.

Note that you can restrict Confluence so that anonymous users cannot view user profiles (See our [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/setting-up-public-access-156.html]).

Some of you have also shared concerns around data privacy and GDPR. We'd like to assure you that we’re continuing to take these requirements seriously. For more information on our latest GDPR updates to Confluence, see our [6.13 release notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/confluence-6-13-release-notes-959288785.html#Confluence6.13ReleaseNotes-SupportingyourGDPRefforts].

Best,
 Jenny - Confluence Product Manager
{panel}
fields.summary: Restricting access to user names and profiles

fields.description:
The encoding of confluence.cfg.xml is UTF-8.  If the site welcome message (corresponding to property "property.sitewelcomemessage" in the file) contains non UTF-8 characters (e.g. "ä", "ö", or "ü") these are not UTF-8 escaped when written to confluence.cfg.xml.

This in turn causes Confluence at restart of the application server to overwrite the file with the default configuration and enter the Confluence setup sequence.  IOW the old configuration file is lost!  The following is printed to the server log:

A small point but one worth looking at.

fields.description:
Manage Users page loading VERY slow. 10 minutes or more. It's impossible to manage users in this way.
We have > 5000 registered users.
CPU usage 100% on this operation with no MySQL activity.
This bug affects previous Confluence versions also, at least 1.2.1.
fields.summary: Manage Users page are loading VERY slow.

fields.description: Should show the ? icon.
fields.summary: Add the (?) emoticon

fields.description:
The ThumbnailInfo (which the ImageFilter and GalleryMacro use to determine whether an attachment is thumbnailable) uses totally different criteria than the ThumbnailManager, which is actually responsible for creating the thumbnail.

As such, a thumbnail image can be embedded that results in a 500 when it's retrieved.

Fix so that everywhere uses the same method to determine thumbnailability.
fields.summary: Thumbnails are referenced that can not be drawn

fields.description:
"Your Spaces" should be a macro
"Recently Updated" should be a macro.

Users should be able to add rss feeds, tasklist macros and whatever else they want to have on their dashboard.
fields.summary: Dashboard needs to be customisable

fields.description:
The global reports on the dashboard dont really belong there.
Why would joe-user be interested in :
1) Pages that arent linked from anywhere
2) undefined pages

These are administrative functions - so they really belong on the (required) Space Administration page.

The "new or update pages" link belongs up near the top of "recently updated" table on the right.

The RSS feeds can just be two icons - I dont think text is necessary.
fields.summary: Noisy dashboard 2

fields.description:
Isnt the following information rather redundant? I thought the dashboard was rather self-explanatory. And why would you get the urge to logout at the Dashboard?

------------
This is your Dashboard, which presents the functions most useful to you. 
As a user, you can edit your profile or log out. 
------------

Is there a way to edit it - or make it go away?
fields.summary: Noisy dashboard 1

fields.description: If you have an {include:Moo} macro in a page, then you rename page "Moo", then the {include} macro doesnt get updated - and you are left with a broken macro.
fields.summary: Rename Page doesnt update {include} macros

fields.description:
At the moment, we have only 1 default decorator (whereas we could have a couple of built-in decorators) - and also there is no way to share decorations between spaces.

The solution to this is to have "Themes".

A Theme can be a set of decorators - and when customising the decoration, a space admin can select an existing Theme or create a new one...
fields.summary: Decorator Themes
Decorators must be versioned

fields.description: I've changed the colors in the admin tool look and feel to be green, ahtough the headings in the permissions page are still blue. Its not a showstopper but looks a bit sick.
fields.summary: The new space permissions page doesnt use my colors

fields.description:
The gallery macro barfs when you don't have a page :)

Replication steps:

- click 'add page'
- enter text '{gallery:title=Test Gallery}'
- click 'preview'
fields.summary: Gallery macro error when previewing create page

fields.description:
Right now, we don't index user details when we index their user profile. This is seriously bad!

For example, when you search for "Cannon-Brookes" you should certainly find my profile at the top of the page as it's in my full name. At the moment you will only find it if I include it in my personal description.

When indexing a user profile, we should include username, fullname and user email at the start of the indexed blob - the same way we do for attachment file name and page title. These should possibly be given a boost too?
fields.summary: We don't index user details

fields.description:
Referring to mailing list topic: "More content less Confluence !" The following decorator has the following two features: 1) It renders page operations as a toolbar, taking up far less room 2) It #includes a Page called "Navigate" as a LHS Nav Bar So far, all of our users that see these features want the same decoration. Given the response on the mailing list, I suspect it will be similarly useful to many other users - and should be made the default. Thanks to Timo Colson and Zohar Melamed: ===================================================================== #parse ("/decorators/includes/header.vmd")
#if ($setup.isSetupComplete()) #end
#pagetitle("spacenametitle") #globalnavbar("table")
#usernavbar() #printableicon() #helpicon()
#searchbox()
#breadcrumbs()
#if ($page.getProperty("meta.help-path")) #set ($helpPath = $page.getProperty("meta.help-path")) #end #if ($page.getProperty("page.help-content")) #set ($helpContent = $page.getProperty("page.help-content")) #end ## decide whether or not to include the right nav bar #if ($helpPath || $helpContent) #set ($helpAvailable = true) #end
#if ($page.getProperty("page.operations") && (!$helpAvailable)) #end #if ($page.getProperty("page.operations") && !$page.getProperty("page.operations-icons")) #set ($hasPageOperations = true) #end #if (! $user) #set ($hasPageOperations = false) #end #if ($page.getProperty("meta.infopanel-width")) #set ($panelWidth = $page.getProperty("meta.infopanel-width")) #end #if ($helpAvailable || $hasPageOperations) #end
#includePage("Navigate") ## The "toolbar-style" page operations #if ($page.getProperty("page.operations") && (!$helpAvailable))
$page.getProperty("page.operations")
#end #if ($title && $title.length() > 0)
$title
#end $body 		 
#if ($helpAvailable)
Help Tips
#if ($helpContent) $page.getProperty("page.help-content") #else $fileUtil.getResourceContent($req, $helpPath) #end
#end
#parse ("/decorators/includes/footer.vmd") =====================================================================

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-1839].
  {panel}

As per my discussion with Mike, here is something I would like to request:
A javascript bookmarklet that allows for easy posting to the confluence weblog. Click on a link(or choose from right click context menu in IE)to post the current URL to a confluence space.
I have looked at the movabletype format for such bookmarklets but couldn't figure out how to alter it to work for confluence.
It looks like this:
javascript:d=document;t='';void(window.open('http://{mt.site}/mt/mt.cgi?is_bm=1&bm_show=category,trackback,allow_comments,allow_pings,text_more&__mode=view&_type=entry&link_title='+escape(d.title)+'&link_href='+escape(d.location.href)+'&text='+escape(t),'_blank','scrollbars=yes,width=410,height=670,status=yes,resizable=yes,scrollbars=yes'))
Is there an equivalent way to pass the type information etc to confluence?
Some other references that might help:
http://techgnome.anderson-website.net/index.php?m=20031210#post-124
(this uses a custom php script)
http://catalogablog.blogspot.com/2003_07_06_catalogablog_archive.html#105767281286846573
(for Blojsom)
http://www.clagnut.com/blog/264/ (Blogmarks)
fields.summary: Bookmarklet for Confluence

fields.description: At the moment when you create a user through the administration section, you get redirected back to the user list. This is very bad UI. You should definitely end up on the "View User Profile" page for the user you have created.

fields.description:
Installing a Java Web Start Confluence client would be cool. One that would allow offline editing. Like Lotus Notes, a replication stage would sync the client with its server. 

The full blown server is downloaded with JWS, just one that is tied one of a few dominant remote server (we'd need to switch between say local copy of Codehaus versus corporate).  The user clearly, navigates to a http://localhost:nnnn address while in local mode.

fields.description:
This is a transient bug. 

   I created a space. I created several pages in the space. I uploaded several documents to some of those spaces. I logged out. A couple hours later, I logged back in. I tried to create a new space, it did not work. I received an error. I then tried editing the existing space. I received a similar error. Both errors had this cause:  bucket.search.lucene.LuceneException: Cannot update index.

   I understand that I am just learning to use and administer this as I am evaluating the software. I installed confluence on my server as root and I am starting it up as root. I have am using the built in hypersonic database.

fields.description:
The link labeled "Log In" in the upper right corner seems to be based on the "Server Base Url" specified in "Administration > Configuration > Paths".  It would however be nice if it rather were relative to whatever URL the user uses to access the Confluence site.  This seems to be the case for all other links on the pages.

The problem we face is that users accessing Confluence with a different URL than specified as the "Server Base Url" have problems logging in.  The link in the upper right corner is not valid for them.  There is indeed a link further down to the left on the dashboard which works.  But it would also make sense in terms of consistency to change this link.
fields.summary: "Log In" link should not be relative to server base URL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-1815].
  {panel}

I'm not sure how implement able this would be, or the full impacts of doing something similar to what I am about to suggest - but the theory sounds good!

Currently the process of downloading, backing up, installing into a duplicate context on a duplicate database, testing and then repeating on the live system is somewhat of a long winded process. Something I see as being a big selling point would be the ability for the following:

Context 1 - containing Confluence with its own datasources ... as exists already
Context 2 - containing administration servlets and its separate datasources (in case something goes wrong with Context 1)

The administration servlets would be able to monitor Confluence, take backups from Confluence and store them separately, check for updates from the website and download them automatically (emailing the administrator when a new one is available), upgrade Confluence and if something goes wrong during upgrade be able to roll back.

Think "windows update" [download updates and tell me when they are ready to install], for Confluence (and even Jira). The benefit of this would be that minor patches could be released separately (a few times before I've been emailed an updated class as a temporary fix to a problem until a new release is done).
fields.summary: Confluence Auto-Upgrades / Auto Update

fields.description:
The seraph path-mapper is still requiring that users have confluence-admin group to access anything under the /admin URL.

Steps to reproduce:

Create a user, not in the confluence-admin group
Give that user ADMINISTRATE CONFLUENCE permission
Log in as that user and try to go to the admin console
You'll be prompted to log in.

Annoyingly enough, this doesn't seem to happen when running in the development environment (hence it not being found during testing here), but I've verified if on conf.at.com

A quick solution would be to remove the path components from seraph-paths.xml, since we've protected the admin-only actions through Confluence's own permissions mechanism, but Mike recommends writing a path mapper instead so the two systems can work together properly.
fields.summary: Still need confluence-admin group to access /admin pages

fields.description: Some users have the habit of opening a document for editing and using Update rather than Cancel to close the document when there's no changes which then updates the document's last editing timestamp. While some of this can be mitigated by educating the users, it'd be optimal to not be required to teach users small details like this. Hence when there's no difference between the old and new version of a document, Confluence should IMO ask for a confirmation that the user really wants to save a new identical version.
fields.summary: Updating with no changes should ask for confirmation

fields.description:
The daily email listing notifications of interest to the user included new users with modified user profiles.

We wish only to send out modified user profiles. 

This issue is being added in hindsight to the fix. We simply built the changed user list by checking that the profile had been modified (lastModifiedBy()) by the user, which guarantees that the user has logged in and added content to their profile.

See com.atlassian.confluence.mail.report.ChangeDigestReport, also the HTML and text email templates for notifications.
fields.summary: Modified user list was being confused with new user list for daily email notifications
